definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Then she smiled and ran towards the court to go on practice.
sentences.chinese: 說完她笑了笑，跑向籃球場繼續練球。

sentences.english: John is a real Rambo in the basketball court.
sentences.chinese: 約翰在籃球場上像藍波一樣勇猛。

sentences.english: They turned basketball's smartest crunch-time team into dummies.
sentences.chinese: 他們讓籃球場上關鍵時刻最聰明的球隊變成了笨蛋。

sentences.english: Stevie Franchise was a thing of beauty on the basketball court.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯是籃球場上的驕子。

sentences.english: Electric lights lit up the basket-ball ground.
But there is one emblazoned with a framed black-and-white photograph of a basketball court.
sentences.chinese: 但是還有一種是紋以一個籃球場的黑白框相片。

sentences.english: On the right there is a football field and two basketball courts.
sentences.chinese: 右邊是一個足球場，兩個籃球場。

sentences.english: Many of the lessons I learned on the basketball court still guide me today. See if they apply to your business
sentences.chinese: 我從籃球場上學到的許多經驗教訓現在仍然在指導我。

sentences.english: He is away from the basketball court now.
sentences.chinese: 下課時間維特和傑森在籃球場裏。

sentences.english: Electric lights lit up the basket-ball ground.
sentences.chinese: 電燈把籃球場照得亮堂堂的。

sentences.english: Basketball court No3 is in front of that building.
sentences.chinese: 第3籃球場在那棟房的前面。
